image.altText: An archive photo of a man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Steele Hall's parliamentary career stretched more than 33 years, including stints in both the federal and state parliaments.

title.children: Former SA premier Steele Hall dies aged 95

image.altText: Donald Trump and Malcolm Turnbull

props.synopsis: Malcolm Turnbull warns that a second Donald Trump White House would only be emboldened by the former president's legal troubles and that an Australian PM must stand their ground.

title.children: 'Trump is a bully': Turnbull opens up on what a second Trump presidency would mean

image.altText: Frances Adamson with her arm around her mother Jennifer Cashmore

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Jennifer Cashmore AM, the mother of South Australian Governor Frances Adamson, has been remembered for her "trailblazing legacy" following her death at 86.

title.children: Former Liberal MP Jennifer Cashmore's 'trailblazing legacy' remembered

image.altText: A police helicopter searches the ocean.

props.synopsis: Three women have been swept off the rocks at Kurnell in the Sutherland Shire, sparking a major emergency response. One woman managed to make it back to shore but the other two were pronounced dead after being pulled unconscious from the ocean.

title.children: Two women dead after being swept off rocks in Sydney's south

image.altText: Swimmer Ariarne Titmus smiles and punches her first in the pool after winning a final

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus misses breaking her own world record by just 0.06 seconds but books her place for Paris 2024 at the Australian Olympic Swimming Trials.

title.children: Ariarne Titmus narrowly misses world record to send ominous warning to 400m rivals

image.altText: A drone shot of Port Lincoln, South Australia.

props.synopsis: In two years time this region of Australia could run out of drinking water but the solution is not in line with the wishes of one peak industry.

title.children: 'The water situation is dire': This city faces running out of water inside two years

image.altText: Kate White in collage with images of her electricity bill and a meter behind her.

props.synopsis: Estimates for gas and energy bills has been a common practice across Australia for years, but many people don't know to check.

title.children: Kate's 'very large' gas bill was more than halved when she asked one simple question

image.altText: Peter Costello wears a dark jacket and a check shirt

props.synopsis: The failure of Peter Costello to properly address his run-in with a journalist at Canberra Airport has ended his long tenure at the media company and handed a "toxic baton" to his replacement, writes Peter Ryan.

title.children: Peter Costello's 'brain fade' has brought his career at Nine to an end, and left his successor with a huge mess to clean up

image.altText: Christian Petracca grimaces and holds his ribs as he his led by the arm off the field by a Melbourne Demons trainer.

props.synopsis: Melbourne has been left counting the cost of a 38-point loss to Collingwood on the King's Birthday public holiday after star midfielder Christian Petracca was taken to hospital following a nasty rib injury.

title.children: 'He can barely move': Petracca flattened in Demons' King's Birthday loss to Collingwood

image.altText: A man wearing glasses stands next to a woman.

props.synopsis: The Greek coast guard moves the body of television doctor Michael Mosley, after it was found on the island of Symi, where the 67-year-old was holidaying with his wife.

title.children: Michael Mosley's wife comforted by 'outpouring' of love after tragic end to search for missing TV personality in Greece

image.altText: Michael Mosley speaks on a morning talk show wearing a blazer, blue shirt and glasses

props.synopsis: The disappearance of Dr Michael Mosley caught the world's attention. The days-long search operation ended when a cameraman spotted "something black" on the rocks that had been searched "I don't know how many times".

title.children: 'Exactly the guy we're looking for': How the search for Michael Mosley unfolded

image.altText: A man selling the catch of the day sits among the hustle of a vibrant fresh market in Pondicherry, India.

props.synopsis: A fisherman in Burma, a winery in France, and a wedding party in China are among the winning shots in this year's Food Photography Awards.

title.children: From dumplings to daiquiris: Check out the winners from this year's Food Photography Awards

image.altText: A man wearing a button up and cap sits in the drivers side of a car, he is smiling

props.synopsis: Despite the large distances travelled, more country Australians are buying and driving electric vehicles. So what's it really like?

title.children: David swapped his LandCruiser for an EV. He says he's saved $35k in diesel

image.altText: A man in hiking gear squats, he's on a clearing, high above bushland. It stretches out in the distance behind him.

props.synopsis: This one-time Greens candidate, who is waging war on wind turbines, has found an unlikely ally — and a receptive audience — in Queensland's coal country.

title.children: He's the greenie fighting windfarms. In coal country he's found an unlikely ally

image.altText: Four people look on in disbelief at the remains of their home, which is now concrete rubble, following an airstrike

props.synopsis: Hamas has had its day of reckoning over the violent October 7 attacks, but Israel's day of reckoning for its eight-month-long response is still to come. The question is, has its response been proportional?

title.children: An Australian psychologist travelled to Gaza. What she saw were 'frozen' children

image.altText: Man with a hi vis vest looks at bottles in a factory.

props.synopsis: From a more efficient furnace to increased recycling, a South Australian glass plant is moving to cut its energy use to provide savings for itself and potential benefits to other users. And it's qualified for a new efficiency scheme.

title.children: Making wine bottles takes a lot of energy. This glass plant is aiming to make the process more efficient

image.altText: Two men in firefighter gear standing next to a fire truck in front of a house damaged by fire

props.synopsis: Firefighters are reminding people to consider the consequences of not having working smoke alarms after the death of an elderly man in a Broken Hill home overnight.

title.children: Man's death in Broken Hill housefire prompts smoke detector warning

image.altText: A US consulate in the city with its windows smashed and spray-painted with red triangles

props.synopsis: The prime minister has called for calm after the US consulate in Sydney has been vandalised in what police suspect is a politically motivated act.

title.children: US consulate's windows smashed, doors spray-painted in suspected politically motivated act

image.altText: man in a red flano giving a thumbs up

props.synopsis: Scott Pilton, 48, died of a brain bleed two days after he was attacked on Queensland's Lamb Island in May 2020.

title.children: Man 'beaten effectively to death' by murder accused, who claimed to have found the victim in bed with his girlfriend, court hears

image.altText: Mad Max Furiosa stars

props.synopsis: From bullied schoolboy to Hollywood hopeful, this is how Quaden Bayles triumphed over the trolls and followed his dreams.

title.children: Mad Max actor Quaden Bayles is 'a whole different person' four years on from viral bullying video

image.altText: A statue of King George without his head and red paint splattered behind it.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police is investigating after the King George statue in Melbourne was found beheaded and spray-painted red.

title.children: A Melbourne statue has been beheaded and spray-painted red

image.altText: Tour of Britain

props.synopsis: Australian cyclist Ruby Roseman-Gannon wins the final stage of the Tour of Britain after an opponent celebrated early as they crossed the finish line.

title.children: Australian overtakes cyclist who celebrated early to win the final stage of the Tour of Britain

image.altText: A whale as seen from the air, swimming in the ocean, entangled with a long rope.

props.synopsis: Marine rescue authorities are searching waters near Port Macquarie for the whale, which is the fourth to have been entangled off the northern NSW coast this holiday weekend.

title.children: Humpback whale entangled in fishing rope off NSW coast as marine crews on standby for multiple rescues

image.altText: Brown cardboard boxes in the back of a vehicle with a police officer in the background

props.synopsis: Police have seized more than 800kg of loose tobacco leaf and thousands of vapes and cigarettes being transported between Sydney and Melbourne on the Hume Highway in NSW.

title.children: Highway patrol intercepts nearly $2 million worth of illegal tobacco bound for Sydney and Melbourne

image.altText: Little penguin

props.synopsis: Rockingham locals call for the state government to take action over the rapidly declining population of little penguins on Penguin Island, with just 114 birds remaining.

title.children: Less than 120 iconic birds left at Penguin Island, as race to save species ramps up

image.altText: A man looks distressed after losing an NRL match

props.synopsis: With the entire NRL existing in State of Origin's shadow for the time being, Mitchell Moses had the most to gain from the King's Birthday weekend. But did he do enough to press his case for Game II?

title.children: How the search for State of Origin saviours turns the NRL into an individual sport

image.altText: People sunbathe under a row of umbrellas at a beach on Greece.

props.synopsis: Every winter a large cohort of Australians head north for the European summer. But with growing tourism hostility sweeping many visitor hotspots, they may not be getting such a warm welcome.

title.children: Why Aussies sipping Aperol in the 'Euro Summer' sun may not get a warm welcome

image.altText: door snake

props.synopsis: Whether your priority is to make life in your rental property less of Survivor-style experience, keep energy costs down, or just to be cosier, winter can be a season of challenge.

title.children: Dread the cold? These cheap items will help you stay warm this winter

image.altText: A composite image of a superman cartoon and a batman cartoon with robin in the background.

props.synopsis: A copy of Batman #1 also fetched $60,000, more than five times its starting price.

title.children: Rare Superman comic sells for $189,000 at UK auction to Australian buyer

image.altText: A woman in a white jersey with the words Fever and number 22 pushes a woman in a black jersey away

props.synopsis: US basketball sensation Caitlin Clark said her snub from the upcoming US Olympics team had given her "something to work for" as her Indiana Fevers coach says she was a "little disappointed" by the move.

title.children: Basketball star Caitlin Clark tells coach Team USA 'woke a monster' after Olympics snub

image.altText: A woman and a man stand behind beer taps in a bar

props.synopsis: A Melbourne couple had just moved to the small border town of Apsley to take over the town's pub when a car crashed through their bar. After extensive repairs, the inn reopened for the long weekend.

title.children: They left the city to run a 170-year-old country pub. Then a car drove through the front bar

image.altText: A screenshot of a woman mid-air as she gets flipped by a bull.

props.synopsis: A woman is flipped through the air by a charging bull after the animal escaped a rodeo ring during an event in the United States.

title.children: Woman flipped through the air after bull called Party Bus escapes through the crowd at US rodeo

image.altText: Cate Campbell

props.synopsis: A group of high-profile veterans will look to make Australia's Olympic swimming team, as increased financial help makes it possible to stay in the sport longer.

title.children: Australia's swimming team is getting older each year, and the head coach believes that's great for our Olympic hopes
